answers.answer: Do you have an exposure for hepatitis b or c?  Such as unprotected sex with a person of unknown status, intravenous drug use (even many years ago), blood transfusion.Sexual activity  is the primary method to transmit hep b and drug use is the primary method to transmit hep c.When the doctor said only one liver enzyme was elevated, he was probably referring to your Alt.Don't freak out.  there are many other reasons for elevated liver tests besides hepatitis.  Alcohol consumption/wilson's disease, etc.If you are worried about hepatitis, ask for an antibody test.  I have a feeling you will be neg.

I am sexually active but always use protection. I do not use drugs or drink alcohol.Is it alright to have symptoms (such as dry mouth, stomach pain, weakness) for such a long time? Its been about a month.Besides alcohol consumption and Wilson's disease, do you know of any other with the systems I have?

Well, I don't know of any other specific diseases which are related to elevated liver function.  Have you ever been tested for hep b and c?  If you want to put your mind at ease call request a test .com.  1-888-732-2348.  Ask for the hepatitis b and c test.  cost you, maybe, 100.This will put your mind at ease.But you are not even sure which liver enzyme is elevated.  It could be your protein or albumin or ast or bilirubin.

HepC very very rarely has anything to do with being sexually active - it's not transmitted that way really.It is a blood to blood borne disease. Have you had a transfusion? Used an IV drug? Been to a dentist or a nail salon? Gotten vaccinated?If so you could have Hep.There is a very simple blood test that will tell you for sure.  Dry mouth and stuff isn't an indication of anything and the last thing I"d presume is Hepc.You need more detective work done by a doctor - it could be anything.
Could you be diabetic? Dry mouth....tired(weak)...have you checked?
it would be pragmatic to get an HCV antibody, HBSAg as well as LFTs tested.
I thought it was diabetes too at first. But I got tested and everything on that end is normal.

question: Hi,I am a 24yo male and about 9 months ago, I had a viral infection and strep throat with a high fever, soar throat, rash (not itchy), weakness, etc. I took antibiotics for it and was fine for 2 weeks then it came back. I took another round of antibiotics and was fine for a week when minor symptoms appeared again. within a few days they were gone so i didn't go to the doctor. A few months later I had sever diarrhea that last five days. Between then and now, I've had minor fever, weakness every so often and abnormal stools. In the past month, I got a dry mouth, leading to weakness, abdominal pain, and diarrhea (tan colored). I am not the kind of person who goes to the doctors often so I put off the dry mouth for three weeks and when I got sicker I made an appointment. The doctor mailed the blood test results back to me with the only thing saying "for the liver function tests: elevation in one test only. please keep scheduled appointment in one month to test again and discuss further."What does that mean? Should I call and get more information? Should I wait that long without treatment? I still have the dry mouth and have periods of weakness, stomach pain and diarrhea. Does this sound like hepatitis?Thanks
title: Liver Function Tests
